intro: Henslowia robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's henslowia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as swampy woods and along stream banks. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species.
